titleStmt.title: William M. Samuel, R. J. Brown, and B. J. Pullen, Affidavit
CWG2545

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Beriah Magoffin: Governor's Official Correspondence File, Civil Appointments, 1859-1862

body.p: We William. M. Samuel, R. J. Brown, and B. J. Pullen, duly authorized to compare the Poll Books for the County of Bourbon do certify that at an Election held in said County on the 5" day of August 1861. Robert McMillian was duly elected to fill the office of Justice of the Peace in the North Middle Town district No. 4 in room of James Scott resigned
Given under our hands this 8" day of Augt. 1861

B. J. Pullen S. B. C
Jn. Jesse. W. Talbutt D. S.
Wm. M. Samuel P. J. B. C.
R. J. Brown C B C C
N G Darnall was commissioned in room Scott

Bourbon Co
J. P.
Comd. Sept 3. 1861
